text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/29a86ffee794bc1a0efde215c203cf9529047252|patch 8.2.1641: Vim9: cannot use 0 or 1 where a bool is expected>
patch 8.2.1641: Vim9: cannot use 0 or 1 where a bool is expected

Problem:    Vim9: cannot use 0 or 1 where a bool is expected.
Solution:   Allow using 0 and 1 for a bool type. (closes #6903)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1641: Vim9: cannot use 0 or 1 where a bool is expected · vim/vim@29a86ff
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1641: Vim9: cannot use 0 or 1 where a bool is expected · vim/vim@29a86ff
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: cannot use 0 or 1 where a bool is expected. Solution: Allow using 0 and 1 for a bool type. (closes #6903)

patch 8.2.1640: Amiga: missing header for getgrgid()

Problem:    Amiga: missing header for getgrgid().
Solution:   Add the grp.h header. (Ola Söder, closes #6906)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/64075b0ab18449132ed01a07874fe1d1f3f356d4|patch 8.2.1639: options window cannot be translated>
patch 8.2.1639: options window cannot be translated

Problem:    Options window cannot be translated.
Solution:   Get the translation for "local to" texts once and use them in many
            places. Fix that 'whichwrap' is not a local option. (issue #6800)

attachments.title: patch 8.2.1639: options window cannot be translated · vim/vim@64075b0

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/8e9be208ea58149c4e522166a6194da18a2eced7|patch 8.2.1638: leaking memory when popup filter function can't be ca…>
patch 8.2.1638: leaking memory when popup filter function can't be called

Problem:    Leaking memory when popup filter function can't be called.
Solution:   Don't return too soon.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1638: leaking memory when popup filter function can't be ca… · vim/vim@8e9be20
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1638: leaking memory when popup filter function can't be ca… · vim/vim@8e9be20
attachments.text: …lled Problem: Leaking memory when popup filter function can't be called. Solution: Don't return too soon.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c3516f7e4507c77424b94cb89071f6d0841f4e6a|patch 8.2.1637: Vim9: :put ={expr} does not work inside :def function>
patch 8.2.1637: Vim9: :put ={expr} does not work inside :def function

Problem:    Vim9: :put ={expr} does not work inside :def function.
Solution:   Add ISN_PUT. (closes #6397)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1637: Vim9: :put ={expr} does not work inside :def function · vim/vim@c3516f7
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1637: Vim9: :put ={expr} does not work inside :def function · vim/vim@c3516f7
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: :put ={expr} does not work inside :def function. Solution: Add ISN_PUT. (closes #6397)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/6defa7bf0a8935cc44f3dc12e9c87bbb40f190b7|patch 8.2.1636: get stuck if a popup filter causes an error>
patch 8.2.1636: get stuck if a popup filter causes an error

Problem:    Get stuck if a popup filter causes an error.
Solution:   Check whether the function can be called and does not cause an
            error.  (closes #6902)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1636: get stuck if a popup filter causes an error · vim/vim@6defa7b
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1636: get stuck if a popup filter causes an error · vim/vim@6defa7b
attachments.text: Problem: Get stuck if a popup filter causes an error. Solution: Check whether the function can be called and does not cause an error. (closes #6902)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/57ad94c5a9ee6f3626e1ec728519a8558a4346c8|patch 8.2.1635: no digraph for 0x2022 BULLET>
patch 8.2.1635: no digraph for 0x2022 BULLET

Problem:    No digraph for 0x2022 BULLET.
Solution:   Use "oo". (Hans Ginzel, closes #6904)
